main.java.com.djrapitops.plan.systems.webserver

Class PageCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.com.djrapitops.plan.systems.webserver.PageCache

  • public class PageCache
extends Object
    This class contains the page cache.

    It caches all Responses with their matching identifiers. This reduces CPU cycles and the time to wait for loading the pages. This is especially useful in situations where multiple clients are accessing the server.

    This cache uses the Google Guava Cache.

    Since:
    3.6.0
    Author:
    Fuzzlemann

    • Method Detail

      • loadPage

        public static Response loadPage(String identifier,
                                PageLoader loader)
        Loads the page from the page cache.

        If the Response isn't cached, PageLoader.createResponse() in the loader is called to create the Response.

        If the Response is created, it's automatically cached.

        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the page
        loader - The PageLoader (How should it load the page if it's not cached)
        Returns:
        The Response that was cached or created by the loader

      • loadPage

        public static Response loadPage(String identifier)
        Loads the page from the page cache.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the page
        Returns:
        The Response that was cached or null if it wasn't

      • cachePage

        public static void cachePage(String identifier,
                             PageLoader loader)
        Puts the page into the page cache.

        If the cache already inherits that identifier, it's renewed.

        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the page
        loader - The PageLoader (How it should load the page)

      • isCached

        public static boolean isCached(String identifier)
        Checks if the page is cached.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the page
        Returns:
        true if the page is cached

      • removeIf

        public static void removeIf(Predicate<String> filter)
        Removes all of the elements of this cache that satisfy the given predicate.
        Parameters:
        filter - a predicate which returns true for entries to be removed

      • clearCache

        public static void clearCache()
        Clears the cache from all its contents.
